trans-unit.source: Preparing your environment to back up workloads using Azure Backup Server | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Preparing your environment to back up workloads using Azure Backup Server | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Make sure your environment is properly prepared to back up workloads using Azure Backup Server
trans-unit.target: Make sure your environment is properly prepared to back up workloads using Azure Backup Server

trans-unit.source: Preparing to back up workloads using Azure Backup Server
trans-unit.target: Preparing to back up workloads using Azure Backup Server

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup Server
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup Server

trans-unit.source: System Center DPM
trans-unit.target: System Center DPM

trans-unit.source: This article is about preparing your environment to back up workloads using Azure Backup Server.
trans-unit.target: This article is about preparing your environment to back up workloads using Azure Backup Server.

trans-unit.source: With Azure Backup Server, you can protect application workloads such as Hyper-V VMs, Microsoft SQL Server, SharePoint Server, Microsoft Exchange and Windows clients from a single console.
trans-unit.target: With Azure Backup Server, you can protect application workloads such as Hyper-V VMs, Microsoft SQL Server, SharePoint Server, Microsoft Exchange and Windows clients from a single console.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup Server inherits the functionality of Data Protection Manager (DPM) for workload backup.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup Server inherits the functionality of Data Protection Manager (DPM) for workload backup.

trans-unit.source: You will find pointers to DPM documentation for some of these capabilities.
trans-unit.target: You will find pointers to DPM documentation for some of these capabilities.

trans-unit.source: However Azure Backup Server does not provide protection on tape or integrate with System Center.
trans-unit.target: However Azure Backup Server does not provide protection on tape or integrate with System Center.

trans-unit.source: 1. Windows Server machine
trans-unit.target: 1. Windows Server machine

trans-unit.source: step1
trans-unit.target: step1

trans-unit.source: The first step towards getting the Azure Backup Server up and running is to have a Windows Server machine.
trans-unit.target: The first step towards getting the Azure Backup Server up and running is to have a Windows Server machine.

trans-unit.source: Location
trans-unit.target: Location

trans-unit.source: Minimum requirements
trans-unit.target: Minimum requirements

trans-unit.source: Additional instructions
trans-unit.target: Additional instructions

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure IaaS virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Azure IaaS virtual machine

trans-unit.source: A2 Standard: 2 cores, 3.5GB RAM
trans-unit.target: A2 Standard: 2 cores, 3.5GB RAM

trans-unit.source: You can start with a simple gallery image of Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter.
trans-unit.target: You can start with a simple gallery image of Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter.

trans-unit.source: [Protecting IaaS workloads using Azure Backup Server (DPM)](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/jj852163.aspx) has many nuances.
trans-unit.target: [Protecting IaaS workloads using Azure Backup Server (DPM)](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/jj852163.aspx) has many nuances.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you read the article completely before deploying the machine.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you read the article completely before deploying the machine.

trans-unit.source: On-premises
trans-unit.target: On-premises

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V VM,
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V VM,

trans-unit.source: VMWare VM,
trans-unit.target: VMWare VM,

trans-unit.source: or a physical host
trans-unit.target: or a physical host

trans-unit.source: 2 cores and 4GB RAM
trans-unit.target: 2 cores and 4GB RAM

trans-unit.source: You can deduplicate the DPM storage using Windows Server Deduplication.
trans-unit.target: You can deduplicate the DPM storage using Windows Server Deduplication.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about how [DPM and deduplication](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn891438.aspx) work together when deployed in Hyper-V VMs.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about how [DPM and deduplication](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn891438.aspx) work together when deployed in Hyper-V VMs.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that Azure Backup Server be installed on a machine with Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that Azure Backup Server be installed on a machine with Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter.

trans-unit.source: A lot of the prerequisites are automatically covered with the latest version of the Windows operating system.
trans-unit.target: A lot of the prerequisites are automatically covered with the latest version of the Windows operating system.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to join this server to a domain at some point, it is recommended that the domain-joining activity be done before the Azure Backup Server installation.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to join this server to a domain at some point, it is recommended that the domain-joining activity be done before the Azure Backup Server installation.

trans-unit.source: Moving an existing Azure Backup Server machine to a new domain after deployment is *not supported*
trans-unit.target: Moving an existing Azure Backup Server machine to a new domain after deployment is *not supported*

trans-unit.source: 2. Backup vault
trans-unit.target: 2. Backup vault

trans-unit.source: step2
trans-unit.target: step2

trans-unit.source: Whether you send backup data to Azure or keep it locally, the software needs to be connected to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Whether you send backup data to Azure or keep it locally, the software needs to be connected to Azure.

trans-unit.source: To be more specific, the Azure Backup Server machine needs to be registered with a backup vault.
trans-unit.target: To be more specific, the Azure Backup Server machine needs to be registered with a backup vault.

trans-unit.source: To create a backup vault:
trans-unit.target: To create a backup vault:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/)
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/)

trans-unit.source: Click **New** > **Data Services** > **Recovery Services** > **Backup Vault** > **Quick Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **New** > **Data Services** > **Recovery Services** > **Backup Vault** > **Quick Create**.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple subscriptions associated with your organizational account, choose the correct subscription to associate with the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple subscriptions associated with your organizational account, choose the correct subscription to associate with the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: In **Name**, enter a friendly name to identify the vault.
trans-unit.target: In **Name**, enter a friendly name to identify the vault.

trans-unit.source: This needs to be unique for each subscription.
trans-unit.target: This needs to be unique for each subscription.

trans-unit.source: In **Region**, select the geographic region for the vault.
trans-unit.target: In **Region**, select the geographic region for the vault.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the vault's region is picked based on data sovereignty or network latency constraints.
trans-unit.target: Typically, the vault's region is picked based on data sovereignty or network latency constraints.

trans-unit.source: Create backup vault
trans-unit.target: Create backup vault

trans-unit.source: Click **Create Vault**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create Vault**.

trans-unit.source: It can take a while for the backup vault to be created.
trans-unit.target: It can take a while for the backup vault to be created.

trans-unit.source: Monitor the status notifications at the bottom of the portal.
trans-unit.target: Monitor the status notifications at the bottom of the portal.

trans-unit.source: Create vault toast notification
trans-unit.target: Create vault toast notification

trans-unit.source: A message confirms that the vault has been successfully created and it will be listed in the Recovery Services page as Active.
trans-unit.target: A message confirms that the vault has been successfully created and it will be listed in the Recovery Services page as Active.

trans-unit.source: List of backup vaults
trans-unit.target: List of backup vaults

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the appropriate storage redundancy option is chosen right after the vault has been created.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the appropriate storage redundancy option is chosen right after the vault has been created.

trans-unit.source: Read more about [geo-redundant](../storage/storage-redundancy.md#geo-redundant-storage) and [locally redundant](../storage/storage-redundancy.md#locally-redundant-storage) options in this [overview](../storage/storage-redundancy.md)
trans-unit.target: Read more about [geo-redundant](../storage/storage-redundancy.md#geo-redundant-storage) and [locally redundant](../storage/storage-redundancy.md#locally-redundant-storage) options in this [overview](../storage/storage-redundancy.md)

trans-unit.source: 3. Software package
trans-unit.target: 3. Software package

trans-unit.source: step3
trans-unit.target: step3

trans-unit.source: Downloading the software package
trans-unit.target: Downloading the software package

trans-unit.source: Similar to vault credentials, you can download Microsoft Azure Backup for application workloads from the **Quick Start Page** of the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: Similar to vault credentials, you can download Microsoft Azure Backup for application workloads from the **Quick Start Page** of the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: Click **For Application Workloads (Disk to Disk to Cloud)**.
trans-unit.target: Click **For Application Workloads (Disk to Disk to Cloud)**.

trans-unit.source: This will take you to the Download Center page from where the software package can be downloaded.
trans-unit.target: This will take you to the Download Center page from where the software package can be downloaded.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Backup Welcome Screen
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Backup Welcome Screen

trans-unit.source: Click **Download**
trans-unit.target: Click **Download**

trans-unit.source: Download center 1
trans-unit.target: Download center 1

trans-unit.source: Select all the files and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select all the files and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Download all the files coming in from the Microsoft Azure Backup download page, and place all the files in the same folder.
trans-unit.target: Download all the files coming in from the Microsoft Azure Backup download page, and place all the files in the same folder.

trans-unit.source: Download center 1
trans-unit.target: Download center 1

trans-unit.source: Since the download size of all the files together is > 3G, on a 10Mbps download link it may take up to 60 minutes for the download to complete.
trans-unit.target: Since the download size of all the files together is > 3G, on a 10Mbps download link it may take up to 60 minutes for the download to complete.

trans-unit.source: Extracting the software package
trans-unit.target: Extracting the software package

trans-unit.source: After you've downloaded all the files, click **MicrosoftAzureBackupInstaller.exe**.
trans-unit.target: After you've downloaded all the files, click **MicrosoftAzureBackupInstaller.exe**.

trans-unit.source: This will start the **Microsoft Azure Backup Setup Wizard** to extract the setup files to a location specified by you.
trans-unit.target: This will start the **Microsoft Azure Backup Setup Wizard** to extract the setup files to a location specified by you.

trans-unit.source: Continue through the wizard and click on the **Extract** button to begin the extraction process.
trans-unit.target: Continue through the wizard and click on the **Extract** button to begin the extraction process.

trans-unit.source: At least 4GB of free space is required to extract the setup files.
trans-unit.target: At least 4GB of free space is required to extract the setup files.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Backup Setup Wizard
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Backup Setup Wizard

trans-unit.source: Once the extraction process complete, check the box to launch the freshly extracted *setup.exe* to begin installing Microsoft Azure Backup Server and click on the **Finish** button.
trans-unit.target: Once the extraction process complete, check the box to launch the freshly extracted *setup.exe* to begin installing Microsoft Azure Backup Server and click on the **Finish** button.

trans-unit.source: Installing the software package
trans-unit.target: Installing the software package

trans-unit.source: Click **Microsoft Azure Backup** to launch the setup wizard.
trans-unit.target: Click **Microsoft Azure Backup** to launch the setup wizard.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Backup Setup Wizard
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Backup Setup Wizard

trans-unit.source: On the Welcome screen click the **Next** button.
trans-unit.target: On the Welcome screen click the **Next** button.

trans-unit.source: This takes you to the *Prerequisite Checks* section.
trans-unit.target: This takes you to the *Prerequisite Checks* section.

trans-unit.source: On this screen, click on the **Check** button to determine if the hardware and software prerequisites for Azure Backup Server have been met.
trans-unit.target: On this screen, click on the **Check** button to determine if the hardware and software prerequisites for Azure Backup Server have been met.

trans-unit.source: If all of the prerequisites are have been met successfully, you will see a message indicating that the machine meets the requirements.
trans-unit.target: If all of the prerequisites are have been met successfully, you will see a message indicating that the machine meets the requirements.

trans-unit.source: Click on the **Next** button.
trans-unit.target: Click on the **Next** button.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup Server - Welcome and Prerequisites check
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup Server - Welcome and Prerequisites check

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Backup Server requires SQL Server Standard, and the Azure Backup Server installation package comes bundled with the appropriate SQL Server binaries needed.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Backup Server requires SQL Server Standard, and the Azure Backup Server installation package comes bundled with the appropriate SQL Server binaries needed.

trans-unit.source: When starting with a new Azure Backup Server installation, you should pick the option **Install new Instance of SQL Server with this Setup** and click the **Check and Install** button.
trans-unit.target: When starting with a new Azure Backup Server installation, you should pick the option **Install new Instance of SQL Server with this Setup** and click the **Check and Install** button.

trans-unit.source: Once the prerequisites are successfully installed, click **Next**
trans-unit.target: Once the prerequisites are successfully installed, click **Next**

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup Server - SQL check
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup Server - SQL check

trans-unit.source: If a failure occurs with a recommendation to restart the machine, do so and click **Check Again**
trans-unit.target: If a failure occurs with a recommendation to restart the machine, do so and click **Check Again**

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup Server will not work with a remote SQL Server instance.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup Server will not work with a remote SQL Server instance.

trans-unit.source: The instance being used by Azure Backup Server needs to be local.
trans-unit.target: The instance being used by Azure Backup Server needs to be local.

trans-unit.source: Provide a location for the installation of Microsoft Azure Backup server files and click **Next**
trans-unit.target: Provide a location for the installation of Microsoft Azure Backup server files and click **Next**

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Backup PreReq2
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Backup PreReq2

trans-unit.source: The scratch location is a requirement for back up to Azure.
trans-unit.target: The scratch location is a requirement for back up to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Ensure the scratch location is at least 5% of the data planned to be backed up to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Ensure the scratch location is at least 5% of the data planned to be backed up to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: For disk protection, separate disks need to be configured once the installation completes.
trans-unit.target: For disk protection, separate disks need to be configured once the installation completes.

trans-unit.source: For more information regarding storage pools, see [Configure storage pools and disk storage](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh758075.aspx)
trans-unit.target: For more information regarding storage pools, see [Configure storage pools and disk storage](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh758075.aspx)

trans-unit.source: Provide a strong password for restricted local user accounts and click **Next**
trans-unit.target: Provide a strong password for restricted local user accounts and click **Next**

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Backup PreReq2
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Backup PreReq2

trans-unit.source: Select whether you want to use *Microsoft Update* to check for updates and click **Next**
trans-unit.target: Select whether you want to use *Microsoft Update* to check for updates and click **Next**

trans-unit.source: We recommend having Windows Update redirect to Microsoft Update, which offers security and important updates for Windows and other products like Microsoft Azure Backup Server.
trans-unit.target: We recommend having Windows Update redirect to Microsoft Update, which offers security and important updates for Windows and other products like Microsoft Azure Backup Server.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Backup PreReq2
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Backup PreReq2

trans-unit.source: Review the *Summary of Settings* and click **Install**
trans-unit.target: Review the *Summary of Settings* and click **Install**

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Backup PreReq2
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Backup PreReq2

trans-unit.source: The installation happens in phases.
trans-unit.target: The installation happens in phases.

trans-unit.source: In the first phase the Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent is installed on the server.
trans-unit.target: In the first phase the Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent is installed on the server.

trans-unit.source: The wizard also checks for Internet connectivity.
trans-unit.target: The wizard also checks for Internet connectivity.

trans-unit.source: If Internet connectivity is available you can proceed with installation, if not, you need to provide proxy details to connect to the Internet.
trans-unit.target: If Internet connectivity is available you can proceed with installation, if not, you need to provide proxy details to connect to the Internet.

trans-unit.source: The next step is to configure the Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to configure the Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent.

trans-unit.source: As a part of the configuration, you will have to provide your the vault credentials to register the machine to the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: As a part of the configuration, you will have to provide your the vault credentials to register the machine to the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: You will also provide a passphrase to encrypt/decrypt the data sent between Azure and your premises.
trans-unit.target: You will also provide a passphrase to encrypt/decrypt the data sent between Azure and your premises.

trans-unit.source: You can automatically generate a passphrase or provide your own minimum 16-character passphrase.
trans-unit.target: You can automatically generate a passphrase or provide your own minimum 16-character passphrase.

trans-unit.source: Continue with the wizard until the agent has been configured.
trans-unit.target: Continue with the wizard until the agent has been configured.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup Serer PreReq2
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup Serer PreReq2

trans-unit.source: Once registration of the Microsoft Azure Backup server successfully completes, the overall setup wizard proceeds to the installation and configuration of SQL Server and the Azure Backup Server components.
trans-unit.target: Once registration of the Microsoft Azure Backup server successfully completes, the overall setup wizard proceeds to the installation and configuration of SQL Server and the Azure Backup Server components.

trans-unit.source: Once the SQL Server component installation completes, the Azure Backup Server components are installed.
trans-unit.target: Once the SQL Server component installation completes, the Azure Backup Server components are installed.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup Server
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup Server

trans-unit.source: When the installation step has completed, the product's desktop icons will have been created as well.
trans-unit.target: When the installation step has completed, the product's desktop icons will have been created as well.

trans-unit.source: Just double-click the icon to launch the product.
trans-unit.target: Just double-click the icon to launch the product.

trans-unit.source: Add backup storage
trans-unit.target: Add backup storage

trans-unit.source: The first backup copy is kept on storage attached to the Azure Backup Server machine.
trans-unit.target: The first backup copy is kept on storage attached to the Azure Backup Server machine.

trans-unit.source: For more information about adding disks, see [Configure storage pools and disk storage](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh758075.aspx)
trans-unit.target: For more information about adding disks, see [Configure storage pools and disk storage](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh758075.aspx)

trans-unit.source: You need to add backup storage even if you plan to send data to Azure.
trans-unit.target: You need to add backup storage even if you plan to send data to Azure.

trans-unit.source: In the current architecture of Azure Backup Server, the Azure Backup vault holds the *second* copy of the data while the local storage holds the first (and mandatory) backup copy.
trans-unit.target: In the current architecture of Azure Backup Server, the Azure Backup vault holds the *second* copy of the data while the local storage holds the first (and mandatory) backup copy.

trans-unit.source: 4. Network connectivity
trans-unit.target: 4. Network connectivity

trans-unit.source: step4
trans-unit.target: step4

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup Server requires connectivity to the Azure Backup service for the product to work successfully.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup Server requires connectivity to the Azure Backup service for the product to work successfully.

trans-unit.source: To validate whether the machine has the connectivity to Azure, use the ```Get-DPMCloudConnection``` commandlet in the Azure Backup Server PowerShell console.
trans-unit.target: To validate whether the machine has the connectivity to Azure, use the ```Get-DPMCloudConnection``` commandlet in the Azure Backup Server PowerShell console.

trans-unit.source: If the output of the commandlet is TRUE then connectivity exists, else there is no connectivity.
trans-unit.target: If the output of the commandlet is TRUE then connectivity exists, else there is no connectivity.

trans-unit.source: At the same time, the Azure subscription needs to be in a healthy state.
trans-unit.target: At the same time, the Azure subscription needs to be in a healthy state.

trans-unit.source: To find out the state of your subscription and to manage it, log in to the [subscription portal]( https://account.windowsazure.com/Subscriptions)
trans-unit.target: To find out the state of your subscription and to manage it, log in to the [subscription portal]( https://account.windowsazure.com/Subscriptions)

trans-unit.source: Once you know the state of the Azure connectivity and of the Azure subscription, you can use the table below to find out the impact on the backup/restore functionality offered.
trans-unit.target: Once you know the state of the Azure connectivity and of the Azure subscription, you can use the table below to find out the impact on the backup/restore functionality offered.

trans-unit.source: Recovering from loss of connectivity
trans-unit.target: Recovering from loss of connectivity

trans-unit.source: If you have a firewall or a proxy that is preventing access to Azure, you need to whitelist the following domain addresses in the firewall/proxy profile:
trans-unit.target: If you have a firewall or a proxy that is preventing access to Azure, you need to whitelist the following domain addresses in the firewall/proxy profile:

trans-unit.source: www.msftncsi.com
trans-unit.target: www.msftncsi.com

trans-unit.source: \*.Microsoft.com
trans-unit.target: \*.Microsoft.com

trans-unit.source: \*.WindowsAzure.com
trans-unit.target: \*.WindowsAzure.com

trans-unit.source: \*.microsoftonline.com
trans-unit.target: \*.microsoftonline.com

trans-unit.source: \*.windows.net
trans-unit.target: \*.windows.net

trans-unit.source: Once connectivity to Azure has been restored to the Azure Backup Server machine, the operations that can be performed are determined by the Azure subscription state.
trans-unit.target: Once connectivity to Azure has been restored to the Azure Backup Server machine, the operations that can be performed are determined by the Azure subscription state.

trans-unit.source: The table above has details about the operations allowed once the machine is "Connected".
trans-unit.target: The table above has details about the operations allowed once the machine is "Connected".

trans-unit.source: Handling subscription states
trans-unit.target: Handling subscription states

trans-unit.source: It is possible to take an Azure subscription from an *Expired* or *Deprovisioned* state to the *Active* state.
trans-unit.target: It is possible to take an Azure subscription from an *Expired* or *Deprovisioned* state to the *Active* state.

trans-unit.source: However this has some implications on the product behavior while the state is not *Active*:
trans-unit.target: However this has some implications on the product behavior while the state is not *Active*:

trans-unit.source: A *Deprovisioned* subscription loses functionality for the period that it is deprovisioned.
trans-unit.target: A *Deprovisioned* subscription loses functionality for the period that it is deprovisioned.

trans-unit.source: On turning *Active*, the product functionality of backup/restore is revived.
trans-unit.target: On turning *Active*, the product functionality of backup/restore is revived.

trans-unit.source: The backup data on the local disk also can be retrieved if it was kept with a sufficiently large retention period.
trans-unit.target: The backup data on the local disk also can be retrieved if it was kept with a sufficiently large retention period.

trans-unit.source: However, the backup data in Azure is irretrievably lost once the subscription enters the *Deprovisioned* state.
trans-unit.target: However, the backup data in Azure is irretrievably lost once the subscription enters the *Deprovisioned* state.

trans-unit.source: An *Expired* subscription only loses functionality for until it has been made *Active* again.
trans-unit.target: An *Expired* subscription only loses functionality for until it has been made *Active* again.

trans-unit.source: Any backups scheduled for the period that the subscription was *Expired* will not run.
trans-unit.target: Any backups scheduled for the period that the subscription was *Expired* will not run.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: If Microsoft Azure Backup server fails with errors during the setup phase (or backup or restore), refer to this [error codes document](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3041338) for more information.
trans-unit.target: If Microsoft Azure Backup server fails with errors during the setup phase (or backup or restore), refer to this [error codes document](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3041338) for more information.

trans-unit.source: You can also refer to [Azure Backup related FAQs](backup-azure-backup-faq.md)
trans-unit.target: You can also refer to [Azure Backup related FAQs](backup-azure-backup-faq.md)

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps
